comment: Things to know about the class: he provides study guides (rarely do you have to do work yourself on them), he has micro and macro quiz's (small and large quiz's). He doesn't help you much. It all comes down to you doing the studying for quiz's, pure memorization. I was intimidated at first, but as long as you maintain your studies, you will do fine

Mr. Beadles is a great teacher, but his class is rather boring. we watch alot of movies, some are interesting. he has a sense of humor and is easy going. All of his quizzes come his study guides which he posts. reading is required but not necessary. mandatory attendance.

If you are good at memorizing take this class. If not then you probably should take someone else. He post all of his study guides online and his tests are exactly from the study guide and whatever else he posts. We watch movies all the time and he posts notes for those too. If he did not take attendance there would be no point in coming.

This man annoyed me from day one with his seating chart. His class is very easy as long as you have good memorization. He posts the answers to the test online. It's a LOT to remember but just study and you will pass.The only time i wasn't mad at him was the last day where he shook my hand and said good luck. You MUST stay until class is over.
He's a funny teacher, and DOES know a lot about what he's teaching but as the other reviews say, this class is all memorization. He provides his own VHS's though!

Quizzes are PURE memorization from notes that he posts. Majority of quiz questions are short answer. You will spend all your time memorizing useless specific details instead of learning in this class.
Wonderful teacher. Very clear cut on what he wanted and would take off half points on test.

His exams are purely memorization...and A LOT of it. It must be word for word or he gives you 3/7ths of a point off. Classes are extremely dull, and mandatory. After you take an exam, you must sit there until the majority of the class is done, and then he turns on a movie. If you're not a fast exam taker...bring a flashlight. Do no recommend.

His classes are mandatory, extremely boring, and pure memorization. Everything you need is online but you still have to come to class and listen to him/watch old movies. If you like memorization you should be fine but I honestly learned nothing in this class. 1st half of the year you use the book & there are "quizzes" almost every week.
Awesome teacher! He's really funny and his classes are interesting. Take this class!

Started out not bad, but quickly turned stupid. He  just goes off in all directions. PPTs are posted 3 days before test but in class he goes too fast to take good notes.  AVOID. You learn more about unions he's a part of and his ex-wives!

Dr. Beadles knows more random facts than anyone I've ever met.  This keeps the class really interesting, and he's always willing to tangent from the lecture to discuss relevant information.  His tests are identical to the notes, but they are heavily short answer so if you don't study you will not do well.  I didn't buy (or need) the book.

He gives a study guide with questions and answers almost identical to the test before every test. He does expect you to read the book though, and bases class around us already knowing what he is lecturing (no one in our class has been reading the book so the lectures are a little painful). Worth taking if you're good at memorizing!

Old and wise. Study guides for every test with pretty much the exact format of the tests. He gives two different tests to alternating rows, so you'll only be tested on about half of the information on the guides. Overall awesome class, I really feel like I'm learning.

OK, I am a History major, and this man is sucking my passion for history right out of me! This is NOT a typical history class...it has a HEAVY focus on Economics and Political Science rather than history. If you can't hack that stuff...run for the hills. I can't stand this class, I wish  I had dropped it when I had the chance. RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN!!

A LOT of memorizing for tests. If you can commit to spending a lot of time memorizing, it's an easy A, since he gives you all the test questions & answers ahead of time, but not many of them are multiple choice or fill in the blank. It's a LOT of paragraphs, and there's like 7 of these tests.

He is really into his seating chart and signing in every class. I also found it very hard to pay attention during his lectures because they are really dry. Luckily, he posts all of the fill in the blank notes and answers which is identical to all of the tests and quizzes. Its not an impossible class, but its all memorizing.

DO NOT BUY THE BOOK: he keeps it on reserve in the library if you need to look something up. "Quiz" every two weeks, writing intensive, more like an exam. Takes material straight from study guides, lecture pretty useless but unfortunately MANDITORY.  If you are good at cramming/memorizing EASY A.  Just pay attention/memorize the maps/studyguides.
Pretty Easy class if you just show up and study the study guides he gives you.

don't bother buying the book. his tests are based on how well you can memorize the notes. i hate to say it but i prefer younger professors. his age makes it hard to relate to him. i love history, and didn't really enjoy this class. easy A, but college is about learning and i didn't learn much at all.

EH!This class wasn't extremely difficult just a TON of memorizing. He gives study guide for all quizes and test; but like 20pgs of study guide and only 3-4pgs on test. Be prepare to study. All test are mostly short answer, fill n, and 3-6 m.c. Takes roll and has seating chart. Lectures are VERY dry. Not awful but tolerable.

best teacher in the world. always gave movie review and class notes with answers, the test are the same word for word as class notes and movie reviews. just memorize the notes. also get to watch movie every day. such a nice teacher!!!!

He was not terribly hard but he definitely wasn't easy! You have a test about every 2 weeks and there is a ton of info to memorize. Study! The study guides (that you can print offline w/ the answers) are pretty much the test so remember them.. word for word. Not the worst but see if you can find a easier professor. Oh & there's a seating chart!

Don't miss class, there's no point to miss such an easy class & have to write a pointless paper. Don't buy the textbook, never even opened it. Very nice.He'll ask the class if they know who some random person from history is (of course no one knows)..and his favorite line is: "How soon they forget"  So fun, going to miss his class.

EASY class. 6 quizzes (lowest dropped) and 1 final (not cumulative). Test questions are taken straight from the study guide, so go to class and just memorize the answers. He is pretty funny too so it makes class more fun. Lots of movie days but if you miss more than 4 days, you have to write a 2 page paper. I highly recommend him! He is awesome!

This class is extremely easy to get an A in.  He gives you a study guide with the exact questions he is going to use on his quizzes, know all of the questions and answers from the study guide and you will have an A on each quiz. Gives 5 quizzes, drop the lowest quiz score.  Final is not cumulative, its just an additional quiz like the rest.

I love him!Get over the seating chart, you would probably sit in the same seat anyway.Memorize the study guides b/c those are the quizzes.Movie almost every day for 30min. The movie guide questions are on quizzes too. No tests, projects, papers, or comp. final. Take him if you want easy A in History. He is a sweet man even if he is left-wing.
Easy Class! Everything is online, all you do is memorize for the tests. Class is boring, but you can just play on your computer.

This class is basically a memorization fest so if you can pull that off it's super easy.  7 quizzes, but you can skip the sixth if you do well enough on the first five and Dr. Beadles is a very easy grader as long as you memorize the gist of the answers.   Lectures are pretty boring, but you can't skip more than 3 or else you have to write a paper

professor beadles was an awesome teacher. he is hilarious in class and helps you out alot if you are stuggling. he helped me pass with a B and i loved that about him. he is extremely nice to everyone and makes the class interesting and fun.

Wasted class time talking about life stories, most of which seemed to be fabrications.  Can only miss 4 classes or else you have to write a paper.  DO NOT BUY THE BOOK!  It is not needed.  All coursework is printed from WebCT.  Very boring professor but he loves the ladies.  Tests are rated easy and hard, and he randomly gives those out.

I absolutely adore Professor Beadles. While the material may not be interesting to non-history majors he made it fun. He told us personal stories and always kept the class laughing. He gave you the questions and answers verbatum to the tests. If you are good at memorizing TAKE THIS CLASS. I got an "A" in the class...but I did have to study.

Dr. Beadles goes over everything thoroughly that might be on the test.  Although the amount of material can sometimes feel overwhelming, if you have a pretty good understanding you will do well.  He gives written exams.  He is a pretty funny guy and relates to the class well despite his age.  Sit up front and your likely to get a better grade.

He is a very good teacher! Class is boring but attendance is mandatory (he does allow you to miss 4 classes). his tests are easy as long as you study. he posts all the study guides online a few days before the test. but i would def take him again!

I love Dr. Beadles! He is old, but he has a great sense of humor and we got to watch a few movies like "All the President's Men (Robert Redford, anyone?).  He gets a little rambly sometimes, but if you do the work and study, you will get a good grade.  He wants you to do your best. I recommend him! :)
Professor is very boring. Talks about useless things that aren't on quizzes, but gives you the quizzes word for word in the form of study guides. Easy if you like memorizing.

Sooooo boring, but easy if you study for the quizes. No tests, just 7 quizzes, but you drop your lowest quiz grade.  If you are absent 4 times, you have to do a paper. He gives the quizzes ahead of time with all of the answers, which he calls "the notes," so memorize the answers word for word so that you will do well on the quizzes.
Not too hard but pretty boring! He gives you everything you need to study for the test but he wants the answers exactly as he answers them. But he puts answers on the study guides.

He is a great professor and an overall great person. He expects  you to attend class, but allows 4 absences. Very easy material! Very easy to get an A. Boring class....but a great teacher!And the book is never used.
Great Professor!!!
He expects you to listen, memorize, and attend; but he loves what he is doing and he is a great professor.
